intro: Lesquerella lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-hairy lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lesquerella lasiocarpa produces seed pods that contain oil-rich seeds, which have been studied for their potential industrial and commercial applications. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and agricultural research.
